intro: Leptadenia arborea, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its latex is milky and has been used traditionally for various purposes, including as a remedy for skin conditions. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important species in semi-desert regions.
